Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; glaze fired red-brown; interior: reserved band at top of lip, glazed below; exterior: top of lip glazed (plus accidental drip mark); lip and handle zone reserved with band between; faint dilute lines on lip; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the high rim and concentric lines on the rim find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.080) (Phase 3)
